content.content:
The idea here was pretty straight forward: Build a Photobooth for my wedding to save $1K+ from renting! The other want was to have all the original photos saved, not just the final composed take away. I looked at what was available in the App Store, however only 1 provided this service but it water marks the photos, even if you paid for the app! So I said to my now-wife what I always say:

"I can just build that..."

I saw this as a great opportunity to dive into Swift and native app development. This app features a 4 shot cycle with countdown, optional printing with Air Print and does keep all the originals stored internal to the device (with no watermarks).

The Air Print is something of a challenge that I am proud of my solution. Air Print only works over a network. However, our wedding was out in the woods, far from any wifi. But a network can exist without wifi! I took a wifi extender I had lying around, reset it to have its own internal network, connected both the printer and iPad to it and ...worked like a charm!

All told, the app ran for 6 hours at the event with 100+ session and never had a shut-down or major fail.

I wanted to build something that looked nice but not cost a ton. Using wood that I had left over from previous projects, I mocked up a pedestal stand that would break down into multiple parts to fit in a car. I would like to add more of the build photos later as I am pretty proud of how well it came out!

The lighting was a separate build. Using a telescoping microphone stand, I wired up a junction box with a switch to a socket at the end to house a hig watt bulb. At the end was a photographers umbrella to create a perfect soft light.
